meanings.sent1: The dog kept chevying the cat around the yard.

meanings.sent3: The persistent squirrel chevied the birds away from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The salesperson chevied the hesitant customer into making a purchase.
meanings.sent5: The detective chevied the suspect until he confessed to the crime.

meanings.sent1: She kept chevying her friend to try the new restaurant in town.

meanings.sent5: The parent chevied their child to practice the piano every day to improve.

meanings.definition: To move or maneuver quickly and energetically
meanings.sent1: The skilled dancer was chevying across the stage with grace and agility.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was chevying through the obstacle course with determination.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chevied up the tree to escape from the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The car chevied through the traffic to reach the hospital in time.
meanings.sent5: The wind chevied the leaves along the sidewalk in a swirling dance.
